tachyon.client.block

Enum BlockStoreContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<BlockStoreContext>
      • tachyon.client.block.BlockStoreContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<BlockStoreContext>

    @ThreadSafe
public enum BlockStoreContext
extends Enum<BlockStoreContext>
    A shared context in each client JVM for common block master client functionality such as a pool of master clients and a pool of local worker clients. Any remote clients will be created and destroyed on a per use basis.

    NOTE: The context maintains a pool of block master clients and a pool of block worker clients that are already thread-safe. Synchronizing BlockStoreContext methods could lead to deadlock: thread A attempts to acquire a client when there are no clients left in the pool and blocks holding a lock on the BlockStoreContext, when thread B attempts to release a client it owns, it is unable to do so, because thread A holds the lock on BlockStoreContext.

      • acquireMasterClient

        public BlockMasterClient acquireMasterClient()
        Acquires a block master client from the block master client pool.
        Returns:
        the acquired block master client

      • releaseMasterClient

        public void releaseMasterClient(BlockMasterClient masterClient)
        Releases a block master client into the block master client pool.
        Parameters:
        masterClient - a block master client to release

      • acquireWorkerClient

        public BlockWorkerClient acquireWorkerClient()
        Obtains a worker client to a worker in the system. A local client is preferred to be returned but not guaranteed. The caller should use BlockWorkerClient.isLocal() to verify if the client is local before assuming so.
        Returns:
        a BlockWorkerClient to a worker in the Tachyon system

      • acquireWorkerClient

        public BlockWorkerClient acquireWorkerClient(String hostname)
                                      throws IOException
        Obtains a worker client to the worker with the given hostname in the system.
        Parameters:
        hostname - the hostname of the worker to get a client to, empty String indicates all workers are eligible
        Returns:
        a BlockWorkerClient connected to the worker with the given hostname
        Throws:
        IOException - if no Tachyon worker is available for the given hostname

      • acquireWorkerClient

        public BlockWorkerClient acquireWorkerClient(NetAddress address)
                                      throws IOException
        Obtains a client for a worker with the given address.
        Parameters:
        address - the address of the worker to get a client to
        Returns:
        a BlockWorkerClient connected to the worker with the given hostname
        Throws:
        IOException - if no Tachyon worker is available for the given hostname

      • acquireLocalWorkerClient

        public BlockWorkerClient acquireLocalWorkerClient()
        Obtains a worker client on the local worker in the system.
        Returns:
        a BlockWorkerClient to a worker in the Tachyon system or null if failed

      • releaseWorkerClient

        public void releaseWorkerClient(BlockWorkerClient blockWorkerClient)
        Releases the BlockWorkerClient back to the client pool, or destroys it if it was a remote client.
        Parameters:
        blockWorkerClient - the worker client to release, the client should not be accessed after this method is called

      • hasLocalWorker

        public boolean hasLocalWorker()
        Determines if a local worker was available during the initialization of the client.
        Returns:
        true if there was a local worker, false otherwise

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Re-initializes the BlockStoreContext. This method should only be used in ClientContext.
